content.text: What happens if an object that receives a message doesn’t handle it? In this case, HyperCard passes the message to other objects and searches their scripts for a message handler that matches the current message. The order in which HyperCard passes a message to objects is called the message-passing order or the message-passing path.

Initially, HyperCard sends messages to a specific button or field or to the current card. If a button or field doesn’t handle the message, it goes on to the current card. From the current card, the message goes to the following objects, in order: • the current background • the current stack • the stack script of the Home stack • HyperCard itself
